â
Be careful with the reviews or similar material you add. They should only be sourced to reliable/trusted organizations and should be presented in a neutral way. "Original research" is not allowed, meaning you can't describe your own experiences neither advance conclusions beyond what is in the sources.
+
Be careful with the reviews or similar material you add. They should only be sourced to reliable/trusted organizations and should be presented in a neutral way. "Original research" is not allowed, meaning you can't describe your own experiences (neither positive nor negative) neither advance conclusions beyond what is in the sources.
â
Both negative and positive reactions should be included, assuming they comply with Wikipedia policies/guidelines (and common sense)
+
Both negative and positive reactions can be included, assuming they comply with Wikipedia policies/guidelines (and common sense) and are not given undue weight.
  +
We should be careful to avoid listing all the points of the reviews, instead trying to make a very abbreviated version, focusing mainly on the reviewer conclusion.
It is also a good idea to discuss the changes on the talk page if you are unsure if they are appropriate to the article
It is also a good idea to discuss the changes on the talk page if you are unsure if they are appropriate to the article
